main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Corvallis, Oregon on December 28, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as having red and green lights, and changing directions and sizes during the 3-minute observation.
The Air Force concluded the report was insufficient for a definitive determination.
There were multiple sightings in an 8-minute period, and a weather balloon release from Salem, Oregon around the same time, but it was not determined to be the cause of the sightings.
The weather conditions at the time included a high cloud ceiling, good visibility, and a subsidence inversion around 5,500 feet.
One of the witnesses was a teacher at Highland View School in Corvallis.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object with red and green lights
